Reviews.Title: “Berlin 2012”
Reviews.Author: TerenceTameside
Reviews.Content: what can i say about this hotel, well i,ll try and start I was blown away by how modern and clean the actual hotel is, the staff were very helpful and friendly, a nice smile greeted my wife and i every time we left and returned to the hotel.The rooms are very quite even though we were on a main road. The location could not be bettered for the restaurants, bars and the transport links.One big tip is, buy one of the Berlin welcome cards it makes getting lost on the u bahn fun without costing you anything. I can not recommend this hotel enough.Many thanks to the hotel staff and the Berliners we meet for making our stay in Berlin so enjoyable . We shall definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “March 2012 - Business trip”
Reviews.Author: Celine D
Reviews.Content: Hi, I have been in your hotel from 14 to 16 March 2012 in the room 610. The room was clean and comfortable. The receptionist made me welcome and he was very cheerful. The two drawbacks was the price of the internet connection and the street noises and especially the morning between 6:30 and 8:00. Next time, I would like to test a room looks onto the gardens.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: Shadowso
Reviews.Content: The staffs are very friendly . The room is neat and clean. I had a good sleep in three nights. Only takes around 15mins by taxi. There were many restaurants and a supermarket nearby the hotel. However, it's far from the centre of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “City and spa”
Reviews.Author: g h
Reviews.Content: We specialy booked this hotel since we love boutique hotels and especially when they have in-house spa. We were in Berlin for a trade fair and like to combine work and fun. The rooms are clean and hip as expected. We booked a massage for two but for one or other reason they forgot me so the masseusse went home after massaging my wife - leaving me waiting in the Spa area. The brakfast buffet is gorgeous and above standard. Too bad that the waitress forbid me to take picture. Cmon, this is 2011 - and it wasn't what we haven't seen before so I found it a bit annoying. We are not from the competition trying to copy the concept... Location is good and there are enough parking place. I forgot a piece of cloth and they send it to me but I have to pay for it. In one hand I can understand but from service point of view: it would made an impression if they send it free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: T A
Reviews.Content: Decent, straightforward yet stylish hotel with good service, clean rooms and comfortable beds. Getting to the hotel was easy from the airport (it's located close to an S-Bahn station) and checking in was pleasant. The hotel staff made us feel welcome and provided us with good information about Berlin. I had that rare but invaluable hotel experience of encountering genuine professionalism and quality service. Breakfast was a delightful. The view from the 7th floor was a treat and the fresh bread, meats and fruit were the perfect start to a day of sightseeing. The room was simple and well designed and the bathroom was sparkling. Before checking out we had a drink at the bar, which is deceptively cosy. All in all a comfortable stay at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrenEnniscorthy
Reviews.Content: We travelled for a mid-week break in early January. We booked 2 rooms, as we are a family of 4. the rooms were excellent, specious & very clean. Big modern bathroom with all expected accessories. Linen & towels were very clean. Reception staff were very pleasant & helpful. My only complaint was that check-in was delayed as the rooms were not cleaned at 16.30 hours, which I think is quite late. There is no facility for tea/coffee in the room, which is disappointing. Our rate did not include Breakfast, which was expensive in the hotel, so we used a very nice cafe bar some 30 metres around the corner which was a quarter of the hotel price. However, I would definitely use this hotel again. The bus stops are outside the door & the U-bahn station at Adeneaur Platz is only 5 minutes walk. Family daily or 3 day travel card is great value.

Reviews.Title: “expected more”
Reviews.Author: LT1493
Reviews.Content: Expected more from this hotel. Photos on the website were so pretty, that we couldn't resist. However, in reality it was a complete disappointment. Nevertheless, the hotel itself was all right, it's just that we expected it to be a bit prettier. The bed was comfortable, that's the most important thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location & Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dan1976BFS
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fresh, clean and minimalistic feeling as well as being modern and quite trendy. The staff were all friendly and more than happy to help. It's a little further away from the city centre than other hotels, but the walk up the Ku'damm is nice with plenty of interesting shops to look at and Alexander Platz only took around 20-25 minutes to walk to, but if you don't feel like walking there's an UBahn station a few minutes from the hotel. A great and varied breakfast is served on the top floor with excellent views accross the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: ClareandAmanda
Reviews.Content: Length of stay: 2 nights, midweek. Room: Well appointed, clean and modern. We were in a side room looking out on to Joachim-Friedrich-Straße, and heard very little, if any traffic on a night. The rooms are minimalistically furnished but there is everything you need. The underfloor heating in the bathroom is a bonus! The staff in the hotel are exceptional, more than happy to explain where things are and give recommendations. Although the hotel is a little way from the centre of the city, buses run very regularly to the Zoologischer Garten interchange and the S-Bahn Berlin-Halensee is a five minute walk. Berlin and its people are beautiful, we will definitely return for next years Christmas markets. Definately visit the Gendarmenmarkt (€1 entry) for Carol singing, bratwurst and glühwein and some fantastic handicrafts.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, central, spotlessly clean and v.spacious...real bargain”
Reviews.Author: AAM11
Reviews.Content: I seem to have very good luck with hotels, or else relying on Tripadvisor is really paying off for me. This place should be the model for anyone looking to do an arty, design driven hotel; there are any number of interesting touches in the public areas and the rooms (like the funky television cabinets). The room was clean to a fault, gleaming as you would expect in the best Germanic tradition. So was the bathroom. I was wary of the transparent blocks between the loo and the room, leading to potentially more intimacy between my partner and me than we bargained for; but there is less permeability than one imagines, and I cant really say it was an issue (I would think twice about a first romantic weekend though...but then I wouldnt choose this location for that.) The location is extremely central, with all the transport options you need, from bus to U-Bahn at your doorstep. The shopping of Kurfuerstendamm and its historic arcade and its seedier modern equivalents is a short walk off as well. If you have business or shopping to do, this could be the best location. If, however, you need a feel of leafy and beautiful Berlin or cutting- edge hipness- Prenzlauerberg or Kreuzberg or Neukölln are where you want to be. Oh, and the staff are an absolute delight, friendly and helpful as you like.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: AlVoyager
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Western Berlin on popular street Kurfuerstendamm. It is one bus stop by M19 or M29 bus or short walk from S-Bahn station Halensee. The room price is not expensive at high season and can be 50% higher at a high season during an exhibition at Messe Berlin. The rooms are clean, they are still equipped by tube TVs. Advantages: - Convenient location - Good service - Sauna - Safety - Competitive price Drawbacks: - breakfast is Eur 15 but no espresso. - extra cost for Wi-Fi internet

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: bernardlinde
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights recently (May 2011). I attended a conference at the Berlin ICC for which this hotel is very well positioned. Even though access to the U-Bahn is bit far for walking, the S-Bahn station is very close and this solves all travel problems. The hotel is modern/minimalist, but be aware that not all rooms have air conditioning which can be very uncomfortable in summer. The only option is to ask for a fan or otherwise to open the window, but the streetnoise (mainly cars) can be too much for some travellers. Breakfast is great, with a beautiful view from the top floor. Unfortunately WLAN is NOT free at this hotel which I find problematic - I have been at cheaper hotels that include WLAN for free. Nevertheless I would consider this hotel again as its location is quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: LambkinBern
Reviews.Content: This is a great low-cost boutique-like hotel in the heart of Berlin. It is stark but clean, and highly functional. Good shower, breakfast and wireless connection, which is all I need. The one complaint is that being on the main drag means there is traffic noise and there are no blackout windows, but for €68 a night what can I expect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Affordable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We found Ku'Damm 101 to be an excellent hotel. The service was excellent and the front desk and other staff uniformly helpful. The room was furnished in a basic manner and the bed was comfortable. The hotel is a bit out of the way but is very close to varied transportation options. The breakfast is nice, but a bit on the expensive side. This is an amazing hotel, given the inexpensive price that we paid. The Internet access was quite fast but was not free, although the charge was not too high relative to other hotels in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice disign hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heracles
Reviews.Content: Stayed to KuDamm101 for 3 nights. The hotel is very nice, clean and well decorated. It is spotted in a central shoping street but it isn't noysy. Not in the center of the city but with easy access to public transportation (the bus station is almost outside of the hotel). The breakfast is great and the staff very helpfull. Very good value for money. Certainly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - a little out of the city”
Reviews.Author: Ash_Black
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in early March 2011. The hotel is on Kurstendamm Strasse - the former principal shopping street in West Berlin. The hotel is quite close to the end of this street but is well located for public transport on a bus route into the city centre and close to the S-Bahn station (at Halensee) and U-Bahn station (Adenauerplatz). We were given room 318. A room with a juliet balcony but one of the supporting beams for the hotel running floor to ceiling at the end of the bed. The room is nicely decorated. The en-suite had a shower (with changeable temperature and pressure on the Thursday and Friday which improved on the Saturday and Sunday). The hotel has a steam room on the second floor which is lovely place to relax after a busy day sightseeing (or after a night out with the German beers). Breakfast was wonderful. Scrambled eggs and bacon were available within the hot selection, smoked salmon, meats and cheeses within the continental selection, fruit slices, yoghurts and a wide selection of bread. The nicest part of breakfast was the opportunity to make your own tea with a wide variety of loose tea and the opportunity to order cappucinos rather than have coffee. Breakfast is served on the top floor of the hotel and there is an opportunity, in good weather, to take a walk around the balcony after breakfast and enjoy the views. The hotel bar is very expensive, but there is a Kaisers supermarket across the road (near a very nice bakers) to take back to your room. Overall, this is a lovely hotel which we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly cool, Ku' Damm 101, Berlin”
Reviews.Author: UtopiaUk
Reviews.Content: Pretty good, not that central, fairly basic. Nice touches of funky design throughout, soem good service, great breakfast. Nice spa, and garden. Pretty noisy at the front of hotel - main street side, if wish for quiter go for a room at the back/garden side. We had the top class of room, and on top floor, and even that overall style and size, of the room and bathtroom was mediocre, quite nice though. Bit noisy as at the front!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Powerpaddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April for 3 nights, Absolutely superb. Located 100yds from a train station and about 30yds from a bus stop on the main road into Berlin. Hotel itself is exceptionally friendly. Downstairs lobby bar is a little expensive, but if that worries you there a lot of nearby bars. Rooms are clean and tidy, and very modern in layout. Free internet and computer access in the lobby. Breakfast was very expensive though. Go out of the hotel and on the opposite diagonal corner there is an eat-in bakery where the food is to die for and you can get coffee. Hotel was very reasonable and definitely recommend. Staff spoke good English which helped a non-german speaker.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service in an okay location”
Reviews.Author: B370
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ku' Damm 101 for 3 nights in November 2010, in a single room. The room is basic, but surprisingly the size is bigger than what I expect for a single room. The wi-fi service is available for some fee. The receptionist officers - Lisa and Kami - both are very helpful, friendly and provided excellent assistant and very useful information. They even have day ticket for public transportation ready if needed. Very useful indeed. The location is not on the city center, but we can go to the city center by taking M19 or M29 bus from the bus stop in front of the Kaiser supermarket across the street from the hotel. It may take about 5-10 minutes with the bus to get to the Zoo Bahnhof. The neighborhood of hotel is quite, but there is a supermarket and coffee shop across the street - which comes quite handy.

Reviews.Title: “basic room, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Renaat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and clean but the rooms are rather basic. Maybe because of the big congress at the Messe their price was higher, but I expected some more comfort for the price I payed. At the breakfast buffet you have a nice selection of food, and the breakfast room at the 7th floor is a nice place to see the awaking city.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LIMDO
Reviews.Content: great location. 5 min from metro 2 min from bus station. super market just across the corner. the rooms are clean and i also love the design. the stuff were great. we had a romantic vaction and enjoy every minute there. i think they can make the brekfast looks better, but its ok...(a realy small thing) recommnded! we will be back

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: oceanreach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ku'Damm 101 very well situated on the Kurfürstendamm for 7 nights and had a great time. It is further up the street however very close to attractions, restaurants and all the major hubs for bus/train etc. We has an upper class room booked and managed to get room 505 as they show on their website as the multimedia room with a nice flat screen TV, PlayStation 3 and radio/CD/MP3. The room was around 35 sq metres in modern design. It may not appeal to most people as walls are grey and floor is not carpeted however for those that love modern design and minimalism this hotel is amazing. Large room and bathroom with nice view over the garden with a number of opening windows. Very quiet as well. We had a car as well and parking was under the hotel and €14 per day which is average for Berlin. Parking is fairly tight but they have two levels. Spa area was very small but at the same time suited the hotel concept and very relaxing. the bar/reception area was also nice with a very comprehensive list of cocktails. Overall staff were friendly and I would have no problem coming back or recommending it to others. The room prices across all classes is very competitive for Berlin so worth experiencing it for yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: globaltheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the first time, booked it because of a great rate. It was really worth it. I got a single room which was spotlessly clean, the room was small (room 228) but enough if you only sleep there. The bed was very comfortable! Bathroom very clean and pratical, very good shower. Good size wardrobe, a small working desk and windows that can be opened. no airco (could be a problem when high temperatures in summer). The staff is very helpfull and friendly. Alltogether a hotel worth staying, great colour scheme used and very nicely designed. So much better than all the boring international chain hotels in the city. The only things I missed was a bottle of mineral water in the room upon check in and a box of tissue in the bathroom, but these are minor things in comparing with the cleanliness and comfortable design of the rooms and public areas. Location is a bit out of the way but there are bus stops on the corner that transport you to the city centre in less than 10 minutes. Supermarket and pharmacy around the corner of the hotel, as well as very nice restaurants. I can recommend the Italian place on the corner one block away, excellent! For me this is a hotel I will return on my next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to a suite to get a nice big room and a/c, so worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahandaddy
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay here! The staff were great. We slept terrible our first night in a heat wave without air conditioning. They gladly upgraded our room when I asked the next morning for 40euros a night, but well worth it. Breakfast was good, a little fancy but yummy! Internet did not always work but they do have two computers in the lobby which work well. Nice garden and bar and great housekeeping service! If your there to visit Berlin it's a twenty five minute walk straight down the main street, which being young we didn't mind at all. Do the original Berlin walk tour to the concentration camp for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly but a bit strange compared to other hotels”
Reviews.Author: Catsarecute
Reviews.Content: We were received by very friendly staff. English speaking. We were upgraded without asking and this meant a room which was very big but still without any extra furniture, no pictures or carpets. At first you find it very cold but you get use to it and everything is working fine. However, a carpet would be nice. The sounds are loud without carpet and the floor is cold. Breakfast is very good. Underground not close but busses just outside the door and they are running all the time. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel with a capital D - very good staff”
Reviews.Author: RobHod
Reviews.Content: Interesting experience. Thoroughly recommended this hotel to travellers who are fed up with identical international hotel chains where conformity defeats character. The Ku' Damm 101 has oodles of character and style and some of the best staff I have ever encountered. A great credit to the hotel. OK location - bit of a trek from the underground but nice and quiet. The hotel appears to be a converted warehouse of some sort but the conversion has been done with good taste and style. Huge rooms which are somewhat bare and stark with a vinyl floor covering. Sounds bizarre but the overall effect works well. Comfortable beds. Shower in the bath is a tad odd and no doubt there will be some problems for older guests. Great breakfast. And again, great staff. Would definately come back. PS - we recommend the Italian bistro a couple of streets away towards Charlottenburg.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: adelenicola
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for a business meeting and was impressed with the great rates it offers and location close to all main tourist attractions and main shopping areas. The rooms are spacious, modern and airy, design is minimalistic and trendy. There is a great buffet breakfast with lots of variety which is served on the top floor overlooking berlin. The hotel has fantastic hotel rates and for the spacious rooms and location I would defintely stay here again when returning for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “My second pleasant stay at Ku'damm 101”
Reviews.Author: VeVaParis
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stay at this hotel and again it was very pleasant. The location is very good, on the Kudamm, few minutes away from the Tiergarten area and well served by 2 bus lines.The hotel staff is very nice and friendly. The room was huge and very clean and comfortable. The decoration is trendy but at the same time cosy enough. We did not have breakfast at the hotel this time but I remember from my first stay that the buffet was very original and good. This time we prefered however to have the breakfast outside, in coffee houses. I would recommend the Ku'damm 101 at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean but location could be better”
Reviews.Author: MrsHSweden
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the wrong end of Kurfürstendamm and about a 15 minutes walk to the U-bahn (subway) or a 5 minutes walk to S-bahn with fewer trains. Many expensive but good restaurants in the area. No free Internet in the room. Breakfast was fresh but poor variety. Room was big and both the room an the rest of the hotel were very clean and modern. From my room on the sixth floor I could hear the traffic from Kurfürstendamm. It would have bothered me if I had not been so tired. I would recommend the hotel if it was cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, bright, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: BippyBee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip at the nearby ICC (a good 20 minute walk away) and I was really happy with the place. It is immaculately clean, the rooms are minimalist but stylish and comfortable, there is a nice bar downstairs and the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful with anything I wanted (an ironing board and iron were brought to my room as soon as I had asked for them), as well as being infinitely patient with my appalling German. My only complaint is that there was no free wi-fi, it had to be paid for, and then didn't work half the time (the charge for this was reduced, but I'd rather have had the facility, and for free). Having said that, would have no hesitation on returning. Oh, and yes, splendid breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Smart design”
Reviews.Author: Abrah
Reviews.Content: Overall, I enjoyed my stay here. The rooms are clean, well arranged with a fresh take on hotel design. The breakfast is good (mine was included in my rate) and the staff helpful at all times. I was surprised, however, at some of the corners the hotel cut to save on money or to make more money. Free internet is available only in the draughty and quite uncomfortable lobby area. Toiletries provided are minimal and given once only - make the most of those shampoo sachets! The hotel is not close to the underground, which isn't a big deal when you're on holiday but could be annoying if you're short on time. All in all, a smartly presented hotel with it's own distinctive look.

Reviews.Title: “Far out modern minimialism”
Reviews.Author: City_Slicking_Hobo
Reviews.Content: Location: too far out for the solo traveller if you need to be closer to the attractions. For business it's better as it is closer (15min walk) to the ring (S41/42 lines). Hotel: clean, friendly (Steffi at the front desk was very helpful) and more than adequate for my needs. The only problem I had was that the single room that was supposed to have a King-sized bed, didn't. This was deemed to the be a fault with the website I made my booking through. I had a shower room with 2 sachets of shower gel/shampoo and a bar of soap. Food: I tried the 15Euro breakfast buffet one day. It had the usual stuff, but also the unusual stuff. Fig covered in bacon an a plate. At least that's what I thought it was. The breakfast room was on the roof-line and very bright. Pastel colours all round made for a chilled atmosphere. But overall, I think the charge was over the top seeing as there was a breakfast place across the corner. Tip: there is a fast food booth near the Hallensee station selling great currywurst which was a life saver for me on several occasions!! Tip: One night after a bar hopping session the trains had stopped working so I had to take a night bus from the museum area. It went past the Zoolochiker Gardens (and that is the closest it gets to the hotel). Be aware that trains only run 24hrs on the weekends!! Berlin is a VERY BIG city. Walking to the Ku-damm 101 was not an option from the central areas unless you are particularly keen on doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalalatracy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, the hotel is a little far from all the sights and town but there is a bus stop just opposite and any bus will take you into centre or if you have loads of time 40mins walk will take you to KaDaWe! The hotel is very clean in terms of hygiene & aesthetics, very minimal. Check-in was easy and the hotel is very safe, to access floor 2-6/7? you need you room card for the elevator and also to access the section where you room is you need the room card to open main doors then your room card again to open your own room- so very safe indeed! The room is really basic, there is hairdryer in the bathroom which is nice but it doesn't have facial tissue or slippers! The staff are really nice and would always greet & smile. Internet in lobby doesn't load facebook! Lovely little hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianW01
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. Stayed for 4 nights and loved every minute. Yes, you are a little out of the centre and away from all the major sightseeing landmarks but it’s not really a problem as within a 5 minute walk is the S-bahn station (Hallense) and 10 minute walk in the other direction is the Andauer Platz U-bahn station. Berlin’s public transport system is so good that once at these stations you are only around a 10 minute ride to the more central attractions. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean. It has a modern décor which might not be to everyone’s tastes but certainly was to mine. The room itself was also of a good size and again nice and clean. The breakfast room on the 7th floor affords some nice views of the local skyline. It also serves a delicious breakfast, and you need not worry about getting up early to catch breakfast as it is served until 13:00 on a Sunday (nice touch). Downstaris, the laid back bar area is perfect for a relaxing late night drink. The staff are fantastic. From the reception staff, the guy behind the bar, those serving the breakfasts, the cleaners and maintenance men were all very polite and greeted you with a pleasant smile. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they seemed to genuinely enjoy helping you. We stayed for 4 nights and the rate we got for 2 of those nights was very good but the other 2 nights were slightly more expensive, so be wary when booking, but it is probably worth paying a little extra for a hotel of this standard. I would most definitely recommend this hotel and would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we expected + more”
Reviews.Author: ukfemaletraveller27
Reviews.Content: 20 something couple stayed here for 8 days over the new year period last year + loved it. used to staying in hostels we decided to splash out some cash since it was xmas / new year. also didnt want to be cold in berlin in the winter. the hotel was a dream. everything we had been told via the website was true.cool + contemporary. clean + tidy. friendly + helpful staff. amazing food + service. free internet. this hotel caters for all your needs. so many services you'll never get to use them all. i would stay here again + again

Reviews.Title: “friendly-clean-need no more-come back”
Reviews.Author: Nederlandbelgie
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel was a pleasure ! Nice ,clean ,very friendly and helpful staff (esp.Wiebke), breakfast was something to look out for .Rooms (large)were well equipped and easy access to Berlin center. Rates are excellent as well. Finally this is a hotel to recommend. We enjoyed our stay. Lea & Gunter

Reviews.Title: “tiny room, stunning breakfst view”
Reviews.Author: Bab69121
Reviews.Content: The room has been really small... ok, bath amenities wer a bit out oif the normal, but the room size was poor average. Had a room facing the back/ courtyard, what has been nice. Thew best about htis hotel is the brteakfast with a stunning view over Berlin.... cool!

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel but location is a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Tripadee
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place. It wouldn't be to everyone's taste as it's quite industrial in design. We had a very large bedroom. Good breakfasts. The staff were very helpful and went to a lot of trouble to book a restaurant for us when we were having problems finding a place. Although I really liked the hotel and the area it was in I would probably look for something a little more central the next time. Yes, you can get the bus or train easily but that does take up precious time if you are in the city for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Ku'Damm 101 Review”
Reviews.Author: Stark71
Reviews.Content: A neutral review this one. It's not that central, or close to an underground train line. It's reasonably stylish and modern, though is starting to show signs of wear overall - certainly no longer cutting edge. However the room rates aren't too bad, public transport in Berlin is excellent and crucially, it's stumbling distance from one of the worlds best cocktail bars, the Universum Lounge. One for couples and groups overall I think. I've stayed 4 or 5 times and never had any problem with staff or any other issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in residential neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie D
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean, good breakfast buffet. Service was great. The hotel is situated in a more residential neighbourhood but close to the subway and there are a few restaurants around. The only negative comment about the room was that there was no minibar or fridge.

Reviews.Title: “weekend in berlin”
Reviews.Author: msards
Reviews.Content: had a girly weekend in berlin october.stayed in the ku damm 101 hotel,modern hotel,very :german:clean and efficient but also cold in atmosphere nice soft music in lobby but no smiles from staff,good location,we walked everywhere,good restaurants but not cheap.great for shopping.nice to go and see,but glad to get home.

Reviews.Title: “Love it every time I go there!”
Reviews.Author: littlemisscurious
Reviews.Content: In the last 2 years I have spent 2 weekends at this hotel and both times I thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel has a clear and moden design and the staff is very friendly and tries to fulfill every wish (one night we were bored and the weather was bad, so we got a DVD player delivered into our room and we could choose from several DVDs for a very low charge). Their recommendations for restaurants have always been precisly that what we have asked for. There are 2 things to highlight at the Kudamm 101: you eat your breakfast looking over Berlin (the breakfast room is situated at the top floor of the Hotel) and the barkeeper has always been happy to create personal cocktails for everyone who couldn't decide what to choose from the long cocktail list. Although the Kudamm is situated at the "wrong" side of the Kudamm, it is nevertheless only a 15 min walk to get to the central shopping area of Berlin and there are several tube stations along the Kudamm that get you everywhere in no time at all. Overall the Kudamm has been one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in and I am already looking forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Rather sterile, like we found berlin”
Reviews.Author: Herts02
Reviews.Content: The hotel is trendy in a minimalistic, clean sort of way. Perfectly adequate for overnight stays, but probably better suited to business professionals - who were dominant at breakfast, as it's not the type of place to lounge comfortably around in, especially as all the TV channels are in German and there's no mini-bar, kettle, or even drinking water in the room! The nearest tube/Ubahn station is a good 10 min walk - and about 4 changes from the airport - better to go to the Halensee S-bahn station which is only one change from the airport. We asked for recommendations to a lively cafe for lunch and had a 1/2 hour journey to find one (walk & tube). KaDeWe, the major dept store is on the Ku'damm, but right at the other end - 3 tube stops and a good walk. Overall the hotel matched our opinion of Berlin - sterile. If we'd been more impressed by Berlin, the hotel would have been fine as a base, but we found it a hard city to find any life in - perhaps we went at the wrong time of year?? We won't be back to find out. Recommend you go to Rome, Paris or Stockholm instead - much more to do, see and experience!

Reviews.Title: “Still rolling - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: paoloz
Reviews.Content: Second time in this nice, minimal style hotel, i stayed in september 2004 and 2007, wonderful breakfast at the top floor overviewing the roofs of the Ku'damm aerea, the rooms are clean, beds comfortable everything works and well mantained. Hotel at walking distance from various touristically interesting spots, well served by bus, a minute from famous shopping area. Personell are all young and happy looking, it may be that during this period the hotel is mostly occupied by people working in the music trade, i don't know but its reassuring to know that every time i needed something reception solved it with a smile. I recommend Ku'damm with no reserve. p.s. I had a great dinner at a close by Portuguese restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: dontworrydontpanic
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night. The staff were happy to accommodate our last-minute request for hypo-allergenic bedding. Breakfast was a great way to start the day on the 7th floor - it was a shame we were in a hurry to catch a flight back to NYC and we did not get to relax and enjoy it as much as we would have liked. The hotel is not super fancy or upscale, but it is clean and the value for money was definitely there. We got a great deal from www.tablethotels.com and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: viaggiando
Reviews.Content: I normally follow advice on Tripadvisor, but this time I was rather disappointed. I found the hotel not bad but not excellent either. First of all, it is a design hotel, but when you think design think rather IKEA than Philip Starck or Alvar AAlto. It is essentially very basic but painted in interesting colours - it could be a luxury hostel. Of course I am not fond of artificial flowers or carpets or pink bathrooms, but here I got to miss them. The corridors are a bit hospital-like, the floor in cement is very cold (bring slippers), bath amenities are very basic. The good points are undoubtedly the very nice and smiling staff at reception and the smart breakfast. Besides, don't be confused by the apparently central address - given the very peculiar (circular) way of street numbering in Berlin, the hotel is actually at the very end of Ku'damm, which makes it very inconvenient if your main centres of interest are in the new (Eastern) centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KikiOrleans
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Kudamm 101 for 2 nights in August 2007on business trip. Location is excellent, very close to public transport. Nicely designed hotel, rooms look sparse on 1st sight but are actually totally sufficient and nice + clean. Nice breakfast buffet on top floor restaurant, very nice view over Berlin and great atmosphere. Staff exceptionally friendly. Would definitely visit again and recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Girlgoyle
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very stylish and spotlessly clean but it is pretty basic.. The well being room is huge with comfy beds and a very cool TV set. However, complimentary stuff is rather sparse, so I would suggest bringing your own toiletries and don't expect tea / coffee making facilities. The breakfast was of an excellent standard - very wide and fresh selection of stuff, including lots of different types of teas, breads, meats, eggs & cheeses. Aesthetically, it is a very well designed and funky hotel with great touches around the place, well worth staying at!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: ggg23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, I loved the design and layout of the rooms and the lobby however make sure you are adamant about getting a room with air conditioning if you want one because I booked a room asking for such and didn't receive it. To me it isn't as big a deal as can be for some so make sure that if you really do want/need AC that you double check you have it. Otherwise this is a great hotel the beds are wonderful and the service is likewise. Trip Advisor did not let me down!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: alijul
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. Really good location. Clean, modern rooms. Excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: Beti_Mal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ku’Damm 101 for 3 nights during June. I cannot recommend this hotel enough! It was a pleasure to get there after arriving in Berlin late on a Sunday night. The rooms were clean, spacious, comfortable and very stylish and modern. We had a room around the back which was very quiet. The breakfast was amazing with so much choice. The fresh fruit selection was fantastic as was the choice of cereals, fresh meat and cheese. If you prefer something cooked for breakfast, there are also fried, scrambled and boiled eggs available. The staff were all very helpful and friendly throughout our stay. The hotel bar was also very nice and relaxing. There was free internet access in the hotel foyer which was also handy. It’s easy to reach the hotel from Schöenfeld airport, just walk out the front of the airport and turn left, walk inside the perimeter of the airport for a few minutes and you’ll come to the S-Bahn station. Take an S45 line train from here to Halensee station (all on the same line), you may need to change at Hermanstrasse but stay on the same platform and get the next S1 or S2 ring train that comes in, this will cost you around €2.20 each. Alternatively you can get a taxi which costs around €36. I would recommend using the S-Bahn and U-Bahn whilst in Berlin as the place is so big. They are clean, comfortable and safe and much more pleasant than the Tube.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist chic, great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: soundmonkey
Reviews.Content: I have visited Berlin on many occasions and stayed at the Ku' Damm twice. If you like big soft furnishings and carpet underfoot then this hotel is not for you. But if you like no clutter and clean lines it has a very minimalist style in cool colours and natural fabrics. The bathrooms are well equipped but both the rooms I stayed in have had walk in showers only, no bath. The location of the hotel is very out of the way if you want to stay near the new centre of Berlin, but if you like staying near old west berlin's premier shopping streets in a nice old residential area then it is only a short walk to a large range of shops and restaurants. It will take you a good 20 mins to walk to the main shopping area around KaDeWe and the zoo, but there are plenty of cabs and buses along this route and travelling around berlin is fun and easy even if you don't speak any german. The hotel has a restaurant on it's top floor where they serve breakfast. This consists of a very wide range of loose leaf teas, fruit juice and coffee, cold meats and cheese, fruits and delicious german breads, it is very bright and airy with nice views across the surrounding rooftops. Really a great way to start your day. Also the bar downstairs has cool decor which is nicely themed in an understated way to different times of the year and holidays, I have been there near christmas and easter and they had very unusual decorations for both. Altogether a good hotel if this is the area you want to stay in and you want something modern and unusual.

Reviews.Title: “loved it there, modern, trendy, friendly and clan”
Reviews.Author: Bearable1
Reviews.Content: reception was good, friendly and efficient. room was small but enough for two, bed was comfortable and bathroom clean and modern. No complaints. Tea and Coffee making facilities in room would have been a bonus. They did leave complimentary bottled water each morning though. Breakfast was very nice and different to what i had in other hotels. A mix of normal stuff, with nice touches like Smoked Salmon, fresh pate and a range of nice cheeses. Breakfast was great. It has a nice bar by the reception, which is always great for a nice drink before bedtime. Again, trendy and clean. Location was good, on 50 metres to the S-bahn, a bus stopped right outside which took you to the Europe centre and U-bahn was not too far away. Not a bad location at all (trust me, i have stayed in alexanderplatz on a previous stay, now that is a bad location). So for the price, 5 stars due to the small price you pay, you feel you should be paying much more.

Reviews.Title: “Best Yet!!”
Reviews.Author: jonnystar7
Reviews.Content: Honestly the best hotel i have ever stayed in. I went for a weekend to berlin with my girlfriend and I took more pictures of the hotel than i did of berlin!! i just want to stay in that hotel everytime i go to any city...if only they were a chain. best bits: the breakfast...worth getting up for, and the cocktail bar...worth staying in for! Staff were great, room was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Happy -- Again”
Reviews.Author: Zwenn
Reviews.Content: Having booked a standard room for our second long weekend at Ku’damm 101, we were positively surprised to be given a comfort room for the same price. The young staff was very friendly and helpful, again. When the going gets tough in the breakfast room though, the service isn’t always up to speed. Important for those who like to sleep late: breakfast till 13.00 on Sunday is a nice touch. We’ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Once more GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: postoumios
Reviews.Content: It was my fourth time staying at this lovely hotel & once again my stay was excellent! Something that many people don't do in Berlin is buy a city map or get an S Bahn - U Bahn map & Bus Routes map. If they do that they will quicly realise that the closest S-Bahn station is only 150 meters away from the hotel (Halensee S Bahn Station) from there you can go everywhere extremely fast . Also there are so many Metro Buses stoping directly outside the hotel that take you directly to the heart of the city that transportation is absolutely no problem.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable rooms&bathrooms, wonderful design, breakfast to remember!”
Reviews.Author: Hariette
Reviews.Content: we loved the design - every corner/room has a new surprise inclusive of entry, garden, lounge. Nice view from the balcony at the breakfast floor. Clean, large room with excellent bathroom and beds. Breakfast was surprisingly good and wonderfully presented. Fresh atmosphere all around. Berlin is very big so pay attention to what you want to visit and where to go at night and take this into account when searching for a hotel. Subway connections are good but be prepared to travel around and away from the center.

Reviews.Title: “Great style, great value”
Reviews.Author: SFVoyager
Reviews.Content: All in all, i thought this hotel was terrific. The rooms are VERY minimalist, so if that's not your aesthetic, then you might not like it. The staff was hit or miss in terms of friendliness and helpfulness, but overall, most were pretty nice. The rooms were quite a comfortable size and the breakfast was wonderful. No restaurant, but a good bar with a friendly staff and a few small dishes in case you got hungry. All in all, it's amazing value for the money. I stayed here twice, and got a slightly better deal by booking through Expedia rather than directly. I didn't see a big difference between the two classes of double rooms. I will say that the location is not all that convenient, generally speaking. It's at the western end of Berlin, away from most of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Cool but Inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: tvlbug
Reviews.Content: The Ku'Damm 101 was a very cool, minimalist hotel in a quiet area, however the hotel itself was not quiet and the neighborhood was inconvenient to most of the sights I wanted to see. One problem that modern, no-carpet, spare hotels seem to have is the amount of noise that carries from room to room and in the halls. Tje first two of five nights I was there I could hear doors slamming all morning and night which irritated me. The breakfast spread was wonderful and the top floor, sunny location of the dining room was a joy to start the day in. Had the hotel been in a central location, I would still recommend it, but if you are planning to hit the sights and hang out more often in the Mitte section of town, stay somewhere more central. I spent a good 1/2 hour to 45 minutes every day one-way getting to where I wanted to go. I did a lot of schlepping and in the rain it wasn't too pleasant. Their really is not much at all of interest in the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xAbbyx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ku' Damm 101 for 3 nights this past long weekend and had a fantastic time. The location (one 30 minute train from the airport) is great, the rooms were very nice, the breakfast fantastic and filling, and the staff were very welcoming and nice. The Zoologischer Garten is the closest large u bahn and s bahn stop, and you could walk there easily in 30 minutes, or take a €5.00 taxi, or €2.10 bus from practically right outside the hotel. Our flight didn't leave until late the last day and they had a room to store our luggage, which I really appreciated. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. We would 100% stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sean1975uk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel..relaxed modern environment (some would not like the modern look but for me no problem) - very pleasing breakfast buffet included in room rate. Located on the Kudamn Strasse BUT on the wrong end (its 2.5miles long) BUT again no problem if your reasonably fit....and besides Berlin is so big that any hotel is going to be a bit of a walk from something or other on your list of things to see! - Overall one of the most pleasing hotels I have ever stayed in (and I have stayed in a lot)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, refreshingly different”
Reviews.Author: impavidus
Reviews.Content: The Ku’Damm 101 is a refreshing change from the dreariness of standard 4-5 star hotels. It is a bold statement in favour of modernity (with comforts), simplicity and style. The lobby is quirky with a nice round bar and a long table (at the back) for communal conversation; modern art works are scattered throughout, so the impression is that of an art gallery, rather than your run of the mill hotel lobby. After you are handed out your key, which is in fact an electronic tag that you need to use even to operate the lift, you enter a hotel room which is worlds apart from chintz, velvet and plastic fripperies. The floors are uncarpeted (spotless of course) and tones of grey, soft green and beige plus clever lighting, turn the room into a relaxing environment. Bathrooms are also extremely modern and efficiently designed so that you have everything, but without the clutter. My only concern, given the design of the shower, was how the maid could possibly clean it, but it was spotless so they must have thought of a way of doing it! After a comfortable night, I took myself to their breakfast room which is located on the 7th floor, unusual but yet again refreshingly different as you are projected into an airy room with views of the city. Do not expect your run of the mill breakfast; it’s more akin to nouvelle cuisine with emphasis on vegetarian living, than a traditional hearty early morning fare. This may disappoint you somewhat if you are not into fresh fruit and yoghurts and prefer instead bacon and eggs (you have a choice of eggs, but no bacon!). As this hotel makes a statement you either love it to bits, which I did, or possibly hate. If you are into leather armchairs, flock wallpaper, knick-knacks and Victoriana you shouldn’t even think of this place; if you favour instead a more contemporary life style and a change from dreary business hotels, go for it and you will be hooked for ever.

Reviews.Title: “Ku'Damm 101 - Superb”
Reviews.Author: retep68
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights at the Ku'Damm 101 at the end of March-06 / start of April-06. Lovely hotel. Excellent rooms, superb breakfast and a great bar. Rooms - large, beautifully furnished (might be too modern and minimilistic for some tastes though). Excellent bathroom, very nicely furnished and a great large, walk-in shower (no bath, but not an issue for me). Breakfast - brilliant. Great choice of fresh fruit, cereals, eggs, differnt types of salmon, meat, cheese, breads, juices, teas, coffee etc.... all very fresh and superbly presented. Bar - cool, nicely furnished and great cocktails. Nothing like as expensive as most hotel bars I've drunk in. Staff - excellent. Helpful, polite and knowledgeable. Location - good. Not right in the centre, but the Berlin public transport system is excellent, very cheap and easy to use. Three stations all within 5-10 minute walk and a very good and regular bus service right outside the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, chic hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: unison22
Reviews.Content: Loved this ultra contemporary modern hotel, with the best vegetarian breakfast in Berlin - we didnt need lunch. Would recommend it for open minded travellers who want something different and stylish. Staff were very friendly and their trendy uniforms were cool. This hotel was very clean. It was a little out of the centre, but we loved the posh shopping avenue it was in, with outrageous shoes for sale and designer gear in every window. The transport system was nearby and we hired bikes too - a great way to see this compact city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice "institutional" hotel”
Reviews.Author: LtColG
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from 5 days in Berlin and spent my entire stay at the Ku'damm 101. Overall, I was satisfied with the hotel but will most likely not stay there again. Not because of any significant problems with the hotel, but I would rather pay a few $ more to get a less "institutional" feel from my hotel. The hotel is located on the far west side of the Kurfurstendamm, away from most tourist destinations. The closest U-bahn (Adenauer Platz) is a 10 min walk east, and the closest S-Bahn is a ~5 min walk west. Both the S-Bahn and U-bahn require changing trains to get to most tourist destinations in the heart of the city. If you're comfortable with public transport it's no big deal and I was able to get around easily. If you're unfamiliar make sure you get some help from the front desk before you first step out. In addition, there's a Bus stop right outside the front door that will take you to either the S-Bahn or U-bahn station in ~5 min. I usually hopped on the bus to Adenauer Platz and either took another bus or the U-Bahn to my destination. From hotel door, using public transport to the Reichstag took ~35 min. The hotel itself is easy to find with a "modern european" decor. To me, "modern european" is defined as meaning little to no furniture, a darker than preferred room, no carpet, no amenities and no pictures/paintings on the wall. It seemed to be more of an "institutional" feeling (like a hospital or barracks) which didn't exude warmth and comfort. I'm 38 yrs old so maybe my tastes are different from the majority of the folks visiting the hotel (of course all the guests seemed to be around my age). Furniture consisted of a TV, a small table, two small chairs, a phone, a "shrank", and a bed. There was no alarm clock which I found inconvenient, but it was very easy to arrange a wake-up call in the morning. The bathroom was bigger than most european hotels I've stayed in with a suprisingly huge shower and powerful shower head. It was a great way to start off the day. The hotel lobby is relatively small with an attached bar and sitting area. Again with the "modern european" decor. There were also two built in internet terminals but of the seven times I tried the terminals, they only worked twice. This was a recurring theme for me and other visitors. Some kind of issue with the server. The bar seemed pretty active. Seemed to be both locals and guests. I didn't try the bar out so I can't comment on price or service. I found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. Every request was met with a smile and genuine will to please. Even the maid smiled and said good morning in the hallway. A first for a German hotel stay. Kudos to the staff. The breakfast buffet in the morning was very good but not the best I've had. A good variety of breads, juices, eggs and teas. Less so on meats, fruits, and yoguhrts. Again, the staff was very helpful and friendly. The view from the seventh floor was nice but hardly awe inspiring like some of the earlier posts. The hotel is located in a commercial/residential district so the view is of commercial residential housing rooftops. Overall I got my money's worth and am satisfied with my stay. I rate the hotel a 2 or 3 star and a good value for the money. If you're expecting luxury and convenience go somewhere else. If you're looking for a place to lay your head at night, get a good breakfast in the morning and are comfortable getting around town with public transport, all for a reasonable price, consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzboy
Reviews.Content: The 101 is an ultra modern and very trendy hotel. This said it was very welcoming and the staff could not have been more helpfull and courtious if they tried. The hotel is located at the wrong end of the beaten track, being slightly further out than I would normally stay. However Berlin is a large City and you cant be on top of everything wherever you stay, but the public transport system is next to none. There is a bus stop almost outside the hotel and from there you can link to anywhere with ease. Having read here about the breakfast buffet (included in price)I was not dissapointed at all, a great way to start your day and on Sunday breakfast is available to 1pm. Overall a great hotel with great staff. A little out of the way but should be no problem. Actually in a nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Fishslice
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 nights in Berlin, we stayed at the K101 and enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel is ideally placed for a visit to Berlin, right on the main shopping strip with all the designer shops you could need. Restaurants are a plenty and you could not go hungry. The breakfast in the hotel is good and you can help yourself which sets you up for plenty of sight seeing. The S-Bahn is a 10 min walk away and bus stops are a few hundred feet away from the front door. The hotel is very clean and modern in its appearance,the staff are 1st class and very helpfull. Free internet in lobby, bar prices are not expensive. Rooms very clean and comfy beds. We will definately pay another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Kool Dam place!”
Reviews.Author: Steedappeal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well thought-out in terms of the service, rooms and amenities. The very stylish, minimalist decor appears to have fallen straight out of the pages of 'Wallpaper' magazine. My room (404) had a very high ceiling and was bathed in relaxing, monochromatic grey-blue colors. The only thing "off" was that the gimmicky T.V. that rolls back and forth had left marks on the walls (from a prior guest). Also, I never figured how to adjust the T.V.'s contrast. Bathroom was spare but attractive; the bath head was adjustable for either bath or shower use. The only disappointment in the room was the lack of floor rugs (except for one small one)which gave the floors a Northern European hospital feel. Service was reliable and always pleasant. I booked on ---- and was pleased that the breakfast (about 15 euros) was included in the room rate. A word about the breakfast: it is the best buffet I have seen in any hotel. There are separate stations for coldcuts, cereal, eggs and even vegetarian offerings. Superb quality and, especially, presentation. There is a terrific view of Berlin from this 7th floor restaurant (breakfast only). The lobby bar is lively with guests (mainly Euros) and neighborhood types. There are 2 free internet terminals in the lobby (although no printer!). The location is in a mixed but nice commercial residential neighborhood. I do not recommend this hotel for 1st time visitors since it is a hike to the Adenauer U Bahn station (which doesn't have any direct trains to the prime tourist areas). The S Bahn stop is closer but transfers (some tricky) are still necessary. As a hotel professional (Concierge) I recommend this hotel for repeat and frequest Berlin visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, one of the best paces we've stayed”
Reviews.Author: Judith Whicker
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Ku'Damm 101! The room was great, modern and stylish but not austere. The staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly the bar staff. The bar is brilliant, again stylish but not stiff. The breakfast was great, really good range, all well displayed and served. I love it when a hotel has a good choice of breakfast beverages! And really good fruits! And a great choice of cooked eggs etc. And what a view! The location may be a little out of the way for those who aren't able bodied, but if you can walk five/ten mins to the underground, then it's ideal. And the Ku'Damm is a great place for a stroll. Oh, the pleasure of clean, efficient public transport that takes you where you want to go... well, Berlin is a joy, and so is Ku'Damm 101. If you don't stay there, you're missing out. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed in the Ku'damn 101 in Berlin at the end of May this year (2005) and could not find fault with it. Great location, safe neighbourhood, very comfy beds, lovely bar with very cool and trendy music but which could not be heard from the rooms. Excellent breakfasts, we lingered way too long as a result but we didn't need lunch as they were so filling. Friendly staff...what more can I say? Approx €25 from the airport. Bathroom with the frosted glass not a problem. Only one minor thing, I didn't find the AC until our last morning as it was in a corner behind the wardrobe! Thank you for all the reviews as it makes it so much easier to pick hotels!

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off this is a no frills hotel with no frills staff. It may well be a "designer" hotel but when I read "designer", I see "minimalist" which is what it is. The rooms are spartan and unexciting, and the breakfast is very much "lite". The other real problem with this hotel is that it is right at the wrong end of the Ku'Damm and not really close to anything, even a subway stop. This is the kind of hotel that may appeal to people in their teens or early twenties, being as it is an expensive youth hostel. I would not recommend it to anyone looking for a romantic getaway, sightseeing or other holiday. See what rate you can get, and then take something for the same price in Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice architecture”
Reviews.Author: ab69
Reviews.Content: Nice architecture, wonderful breakfast, friendly staff...... very good price!

Reviews.Title: “Cool and friendly”
Reviews.Author: HenleyTraveller99
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that has a reputation for being so cool, it was great to find that not only did the reality meet the expectation, but the staff were as cool as the decor, and equally as friendly. The rooms are undoutedly minimalist in nature but not so stark as to feel cold and unwelcoming. The high ceilings, well chosen furniture and even the rubber floors work perfectly. For a capital city the rooms are also a very generous size. And don't skip the breakfast! The views from the seventh floor are stunning as is the food. The idea of serving all the way up to 1pm on a Sunday is inspired. This certainly won't be the last time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: susan365
Reviews.Content: very cool and trendy, but friendly and comfortable too. extremely clean. has a relaxed feel to it, the staff really want to look after you. the bar is great with excellent service, the bar man really took care when preparing a drink. handy internet access in reception. only slight problem was the fairly out of the way location. Berlin is huge however and the hotel is close to all local transport routes so easy enough to get to the rest of berlin. The breakfast is absolutely amazing, they have everything, and with an amazing view out of the window. breakfast is the best thing about the hotel. overall excellent and really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Futebol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ku' Damm 101 in February 2005. It is an amazing modern hotel which has been well designed - clean chic minimalist rooms with stunning ensuite bathrooms. The staff were some of the friendliest and most professional people I have ever met and made me feel very welcome. The buffet breakfast (on the 7th floor with great views over the city) was a proper feast (you will not need lunch!) and was complimented by the fresh flowers and candles on the tables. They do some great winter deals which mean you can get a double room with breakfast included for 81 euro a night - bargain! You can also indulge in spa treatments for an extra charge. I cannot recommend this place enough, it's brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Cool place to chill out”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleuponTyne
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a real strong design aesthetic. The bathrooms (with heated rubber floors and glass brick walls) are particularly hip. The buffet breakfast was excellent, with some really unusual salad options, as well as a good selection of meats, cheeses, breads and pastries. There's a funky DJ in the bar area on Friday nights too. The only downside is that it's a bit off the beaten track if you're only in Berlin for a short while, but there are some great restaurants nearby - especially Francucci's, which serves excellent freshly made pizzas, pastas and organic beefsteak.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this beautiful hotel for a week during Sept.2004.The staff was very helpfull and our room was FANTASTIC.It was on the top floor and looked like a bauhaus exhibition. Breakfast was great and the location of the hotel ,while not very central ,quite convenient (there is a Bus Stop outside the hotel & Adenauer U bahn station is a 10 min.walk on the beautiful Kudamm) HIGHLY recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Decor throughout!”
Reviews.Author: Lupe94536
Reviews.Content: Its lobby and rooms are VERY COOL !! The location is great and the Reception Desk Staff is friendly. The breakfasts (included in the room rate) are nice... although the staff doesn't seem to project any hospitality or warmth. If you're expecting "service with a smile".... when going to the 7th floor for breakfast, you will be disappointed. So, do what we did: IGNORE the attitude of the persons staffing the dining room and ENJOY the food and the view! If you're a lover of mid-twentieth century design and ambience, the Ku'Damm 101 is for you!!

Reviews.Title: “feels as cold as the staff's attitudes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this place has all the charm of an eastern european mental asylum. I stayed for 4 very long days in september. has a very cold feel to the place and non german speakers beware - only 1 English speaking tv channel (CBS Business report - yawn) which made for some extremely dull nights. it is well placed on kudammstrasse though I suspect that the strive for minimalist chic has overlooked basic comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Lukewarm chic”
Reviews.Author: primascribendi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early December 2005. Ok, it's only a 3-star, but it was nothing special. The location is not that convenient. The rooms were cold (they were, I suspect, aiming at cool), lacked ambiance and were weirdly designed (I mean, I think my girlfriend is incredibly hot, but I have no wish to see her go to the loo through the glass wall to the bathroom -- any more than she does me). We stayed three days, and the sheets were not changed. But the staff were friendly and the lobby area is not without a certain sexy minimalism. Check out was a hassle given that they were not sure what they needed from us. I've stayed at the Savoy (owned by the same people as Ku'Damm 101 and about 10 mins walk away), and while supposedly stuffy, it is in fact more stylish by far -- and, while a little more expensive -- an awful lot more comfortable.

HotelInfo.Name: Ku' Damm 101
HotelInfo.Address: Kurfuerstendamm 101, 10711 Berlin, Germany
